flask_sandboy package¶

Submodules¶

flask_sandboy.exception module¶

JSON-based Exception classes that mimic today’s error messages sent by DMF.

exception flask_sandboy.exception.BadRequestException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when a request contains illegal arguments, is missing arguments, can’t be decoded properly, or the request is trying to do something that doesn’t make sense.

code = 400¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.ConflictException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Similar to a ServerErrorException (HTTP 500) but there is some action the client may take to resolve the conflict, after which the request can be resubmitted. A request to reprocess a job not marked for reprocessing, for example, could cause this exception to be raised.

code = 409¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Base class for all Exceptions.

to_dict()¶

Return a dictionary representation of the exception.

exception flask_sandboy.exception.ForbiddenException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when a request asks us to do something that we won’t do because it violates the application logic. Does not refer to an authentication failure. Rather, it means the action requested is forbidden by the application.

code = 403¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.NotAcceptableException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when the client does not Accept any of the Content-Types we are capable of generating.

code = 406¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.NotFoundException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when the endpoint (or a resource it refers to) is not found. Can also be used if a resource referred to in a request (e.g. a specific job in a /job_status request) can not be found.

code = 404¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.NotImplementedException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when the application does not implement the functionality being requested. Note that this doesn’t refer to an HTTP method not being implemented for a given endpoint (which would be a 405 error).

code = 501¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.ServerErrorException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when the application itself encounters an error not related to the request itself (for example, a database error).

code = 500¶
exception flask_sandboy.exception.ServiceUnavailableException(message=None, payload=None)¶

Bases: flask_sandboy.exception.EndpointException

Raised when a resource is temporarily unavailable (e.g. not being able to get a database connection). Setting the Retry-After header gives the length of the delay, if it is known. Otherwise, this is treated as a 500 error.

code = 503¶

flask_sandboy.models module¶

class flask_sandboy.models.SerializableModel¶

Bases: object

A SQLAlchemy model mixin class that can serialize itself as JSON.

from_dict(attributes)¶

Update the current instance based on attribute->value items in attributes.

to_dict()¶

Return dict representation of class by iterating over database columns.

flask_sandboy.models.verify_fields(f)¶

A decorator to automatically extract required and optional fields from json data, making them attributes of the class instance.

flask_sandboy.service module¶

class flask_sandboy.service.Service¶

Bases: flask.views.MethodView

Base class for all resources.

all_resources()¶

Return all resources of this type as a JSON list.

delete(resource_id)¶

Return response to HTTP DELETE request.

get(resource_id)¶

Return response to HTTP GET request.

methods = ['DELETE', 'GET', 'PATCH', 'POST', 'PUT']¶
patch(instance, *args, **kwargs)¶

Return response to HTTP PATCH request.

post(instance, *args, **kwargs)¶

Return response to HTTP POST request.

put(instance, *args, **kwargs)¶

Return response to HTTP PUT request.

resource(resource_id)¶

Return resource represented by this resource_id.

Module contents¶

Flask application that creates a RESTful API from SQLAlchemy models.

class flask_sandboy.Sandboy(app, db, models)¶

Bases: object

init_app(app, models)¶
register(cls_list)¶

Register a class to be given a REST API.
